gmx:name.gco:CharacterString: Feature catalog for Geologic Unit Text Labels: Generalized Geologic Map of Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, 2005

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A fault is a fracture or fracture zone in the Earth's crust along which rocks on one side have moved significantly with respect to those on the other side. This data set includes both the faults and the line decorations.
Internal feature number.
The representation of the entity in the data.
1-dimensional element that may or may not surround a 2-dimensional element.
The length of the line in coverage units. In the distributed file, coverage units represent decimal degrees.

gfc:typeName.gco:LocalName: Fault, without line decorations (described by Falt01l075.aat or Falt01l075.dbf)

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A fault is a fracture or fracture zone in the Earth's crust along which rocks on one side have moved significantly with respect to those on the other side.
The representation of the entity in the data.
1-dimensional element that may or may not surround a 2-dimensional element.
Internal sequence number of the from-node.
Internal sequence number of the to-node.
Internal sequence number of the left polygon.
Internal sequence number of the right polygon.
The length of the line in coverage units. In the distributed file, coverage units represent decimal degrees.
Internal feature number.
User-assigned feature number.
The type of fault.
A fault is a fracture or fracture zone in the Earth's crust along which rocks on one side have moved significantly with respect to those on the other side.
A fault that is assumed to be at the specified location.
The existence and location of the fault are inferred from indirect evidence. A strike-slip fault is a fault along which the movement of one side with respect to the other is horizontal.
A normal fault is a steeply inclined fault (usually more than 45 degrees) where rocks above the fault have moved down relative to those below the fault.
A thrust fault is a flat or gently inclined fault (less than 45 degrees) along which the rocks above have moved relative to the rocks below.

gfc:typeName.gco:LocalName: Text labels (described by Gtxt01l075.aat or Gtxt01l075.dbf)

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: Text labels for the geology coverage, represented as lines. Standard geologic symbols are included.
The representation of the entity in the data.
1-dimensional element that may or may not surround a 2-dimensional element.
Internal sequence number of the from-node.
Internal sequence number of the to-node.
Internal sequence number of the left polygon.
Internal sequence number of the right polygon.
The length of the line in coverage units. In the distributed file, coverage units represent decimal degrees.
Internal feature number.
User-assigned feature number.

gfc:typeName.gco:LocalName: Geologic unit (described by Geol01m075.pat or Geol01p075.dbf)

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: Rock and material that lies at or near the land surface, but not surficial materials such as soils, alluvium, and glacial deposits. The units are defined by sedimentary, volcanic, plutonic, or metamorphic rock types and by their geologic age. The Text attribute is included to provide a method for generating the appropriate map symbols for display and publication purposes.
The representation of the entity in the data.
2-dimensional element.
The size of the shape in square coverage units. In the distributed file, coverage units represent square decimal degrees.
The perimeter of shape in coverage units. In the distributed file, coverage units represent decimal degrees.
Internal feature number.
User-assigned feature number.
The geologic description of the rock type.
(See table under Text)
A letter code representing the geology.
(See table under Text)

The value recognized by the program GSMCAD and used to create the special font for geologic symbols, e.g. %217 represents the geologic symbol for Mesozoic. Because standard fonts available in ArcInfo do not have the special symbols used for geologic time periods, the symbols were created in GSMCAD and exported as arcs.

The values for Text are listed below, along with the associated values for the Mapunit_sym attribute and the values for the Geology attribute. > >MAPUNIT_SYM TEXT GEOLOGY >------------------------------------------------------------------- >Q Q Quaternary rocks >nT nT Neogene sedimentary rocks >pgT pgT Paleogene sedimentary rocks >Mz %217 Mesozoic sedimentary rocks >lMz l%217 Lower Mesozoic (Triassic and Jurassic) > sedimentary rocks >uPz u%216 Upper Paleozoic (Pennsylvanian and > Permian) sedimentary rocks >PzMz %216%217 Paleozoic and Mesozoic sedimentary rocks >mPz m%216 Middle Paleozoic (Silurian, Devonian, and > Mississippian) sedimentary rocks >Pz %216 Paleozoic sedimentary rocks >lPz l%216 Lower Paleozoic (Cambrian and Ordovician) > sedimentary rocks >ZPz Z%216 Late Proterozoic and lower Paleozoic > sedimentary rocks >Z Z Late Proterozoic sedimentary rocks >K K Cretaceous sedimentary rocks >Qv Qv Quaternary volcanic rocks >nTv nTv Neogene volcanic rocks >pgTv pgTv Paleogene volcanic rocks >TQv TQv Tertiary and Quaternary volcanic rocks >Kv Kv Cretaceous volcanic rocks >KTv KTv Cretaceous and Tertiary volcanic rocks >Mzv %217v Mesozoic volcanic rocks >lMzv l%217v Lower Mesozoic (Triassic and Jurassic) > volcanic rocks >PzMzv %216%217v Paleozoic and Mesozoic volcanic rocks >mPzv m%216v Middle Paleozoic volcanic rocks >Pzv %216v Paleozoic volcanic rocks >Tg Tg Tertiary granitic rocks >lMzg l%217g Lower Mesozoic granitic rocks >Pzg %216g Paleozoic granitic rocks >pgTg pgTg Paleogene granitic rocks >pgTm pgTm Paleogene mafic rocks >KTg KTg Cretaceous and Tertiary granitic rocks >Kg Kg Cretaceous granitic rocks >lMzm l%217m Lower Mesozoic mafic rocks >lMzu l%217u Lower Mesozoic ultramafic rocks >mPzg m%216g Middle Paleozoic granitic rocks >Pzn %216n Paleozoic gneiss >Zn Zn Late Proterozoic gneiss >n n Gneiss, age uncertain >ZPzn Z%216n Late Proterozoic and lower Paleozoic gneiss >Tv Tv Tertiary volcanic rocks >nTg nTg Neogene granitic rocks >u u Ultramafic rocks, age uncertain >Glacier glacier Glacier >H2o H2o Water body >
The shade pattern number from the shadeset geoshade.shd.
Percentage values used to produce colors.

gfc:typeName.gco:LocalName: Rock or geologic deposit boundary line (described by Geol01m075.aat or Geol01l075.dbf)

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: Line separating different geologic units.
The representation of the entity in the data.
1-dimensional element that may or may not surround a 2-dimensional element.
Internal sequence number of the from-node.
Internal sequence number of the to-node.
Internal sequence number of the left polygon.
Internal sequence number of the right polygon.
The length of the line in coverage units. In the distributed file, coverage units represent decimal degrees.
Internal feature number.
User-assigned feature number.
The type of geologic boundary.
Contact
Fault contact (copied in fault file)
Shoreline
International boundary
Apparent limit of glacier
Left bank of river
Right bank of river
The type of geologic boundary.
The surface where two different kinds of rocks meet.

A fault is a fracture or fracture zone in the Earth's crust along which rocks on one side have moved significantly with respect to those on the other side. This data set includes both the faults and the line decorations.
The line where geologic map units are terminated by a body of water.
A line representing an international boundary.
The apparent line where a glacier meets a geologic unit or a water body.
The shoreline of a river. This is the left side facing downstream.
The shoreline of a river. This is the right side facing downstream.
